directions: In a large pot over medium heat, cook sirloin in oil until quite brown.  Pour 1 cup of water over the meat and drippings and cook, stirring, 2 minutes, until a dark gravy forms.  Stir in 3 cups water with the salt, lemon juice, paprika, garlic, sugar, Worcestershire and bay leaf.  Cover, reduce heat and simmer 2 1/2 hours.
Stir potatoes and carrots into simmering stew and cook until tender, 20 minutes.
Stir in onions.  In a small bowl, combine flour with remaining 1/3 cup water.  Stir flour mixture into stew and cook until stew thickens.  Top with peas just before serving.
ingredients: 1/2 (10 ounce) package frozen green peas, thawed
title: Rocky Mountain Stew
